WorkItem.Description: I just need to hold the mousebutton down on the map for the control to set IsDragging to True, even if I have'nt  moved the map even 1 pixel.
WorkItem.Summary: IsDragging returns True as long as you just hold down the mousebutton

Comments.Message:
Well since the user was'nt dragging the map; Yes.

In my case I have an application for a touchscreen PC. When the user presses his finger on a location and releases (for minimum 3 secs) a contextmenu is shown (Letting the user send the co-ordinates or copy to clipboard). But the contextmenu is activated every time the user pans the map. I then added a check for IsDragging, but since it's always true when the finger is pressed nothing will happen.

IsDragging should tell the truth, or change name. In my opinion :).
